{"step_by_step_thinking": "Dimorphic fungi are fungi that can exist in the form of both mold and yeast. This is usually brought about by change in temperature. From the documents, P. marneffi, Histoplasma capsulatum, and Blastomyces dermatitidis are mentioned as examples of dimorphic fungi. However, Pneumocystis jirovecii is not mentioned in any of the documents as a dimorphic fungus.", "answer_choice": "D"}
